Thanks!

> during the Bakumatsu, and everyone is welcome to join in:
>

> http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3800
>

>

> http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3819
>
> The Rise of Sonnō Jōi Activism in Mito
> http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3853
>
> Additionally this has resulted in a blog post on Tokugawa Nariaki:
>
> Jōi and Pain: Trying to Make Sense of Tokugawa Nariaki
>
http://shogun-yashiki.blogspot.com/2009/02/joi-and-pain-trying-to-make-sense-of.html
>
> I figure there would probably be some interest here, so I decided to
> post. Feel free to join in the conversation.
>

messages.subject: Sonno Joi discussion group
messages.msgSnippet: I just wanted to let everyone know that there is currently an in-depth discussion group going on at the S-A Forum about Sonno Joi activism during the
messages.messageBody:
I just wanted to let everyone know that there is currently an in-depth
discussion group going on at the S-A Forum about Sonno Joi activism
during the Bakumatsu, and everyone is welcome to join in:

The Birth and Origins of Sonnō Jōi
http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3800

The Rise of Sonnō Jōi Activism
http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3804

Sonnō Jōi Discussion Group: Yoshida Shōin
http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3819

The Rise of Sonnō Jōi Activism in Mito
http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=3853

Additionally this has resulted in a blog post on Tokugawa Nariaki:

Jōi and Pain: Trying to Make Sense of Tokugawa Nariaki
http://shogun-yashiki.blogspot.com/2009/02/joi-and-pain-trying-to-make-sense-of.html

I figure there would probably be some interest here, so I decided to
post. Feel free to join in the conversation.
